required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Comparison of Technology-based Eye Care Services (TECS) With and Without OCT Assessment Versus Standard Face to Face Ophthalmologic Exam

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the Technology-based Eye Care Services (TECS) protocol to the standard face to face ophthalmologic exam.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients will sign informed consent to enter the one visit study. They will undergo the study protocol and then see the face to face physician on the same day.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with accurate diagnosis of eye diseases from TECS protocol versus face to face eye exam with and without OCT
primary_outcome.description: Clinical diagnosis in dichotomous (yes/no) decision tree. The clinical diagnosis of the TECS protocol readers will be compared to the face to face physician, with the face to face serving as the standard of care. The results will be done with and without OCT. Sensitivity, specificity, positive and negative predictive value will be calculated before and after OCT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients appropriately referred from the TECS protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of participants with a referral for face to face eye care with and without OCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with an accurate diagnosis for anterior segment disease
secondary_outcome.description: The responses from an anterior segment questionnaire will be compared to the findings of the face to face physician exam for accuracy, using a (yes/no) decision tree. Sensitivity, specificity will be calculated using the face to face exam as the standard of care.

secondary_outcome.measure: Inter-reader variability of the TECS protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Kappa statistics reflecting the agreement between two readers on the same photo set of a single patient with and without OCT

secondary_outcome.measure: Intra-reader variability of the TECS protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Kappa statistics measuring agreement of the same reader reading the photographs of the same patient twice (after a washout period between photo reading sets) with and without OCT.

arm_group.description: Standard of clinical care, 8 point eye exam

intervention.description: Extensive History will be taken. Distance auto-refraction measurements will be made on both eyes. Eye pressure using the iCare tonometer and central corneal thickness (CCT) using the corneal pachymeter will be taken for each eye. Participants will have fundus photos taken following the standard VA diabetic teleretinal protocol. Then participants will have OCT Macula and Nerve performed. After protocol complete, then patients will see an ophthalmologist for standard eye exam.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient at the Atlanta VA Medical Center (VAMC) New Comprehensive eye clinic
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known acute or chronic ocular issues
